com.inqwell.any

Interface EventGenerator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractButtonGroup, AbstractInputFunc, AbstractProcess, AnyArrowButton, AnyBox, AnyButton, AnyButtonGroup, AnyCAction, AnyCard, AnyCButtonGroup, AnyCCheck, AnyCDockable, AnyCDropDown, AnyCheck, AnyClient.ClientUserProcess, AnyCMenu, AnyComboBox, AnyComponent, AnyCPanelPopup, AnyCRadio, AnyDateChooser, AnyDesktopPane, AnyDialog, AnyDocView, AnyFileChooser, AnyFrame, AnyGrid, AnyInternalFrame, AnyLabel, AnyLabelFor, AnyLayoutContainer, AnyList, AnyMapEgDecor, AnyMenu, AnyMenuBar, AnyMultipleCDockable, AnyPopupMenu, AnyProgressBar, AnyRadio, AnySelection, AnySimpleComponent, AnySingleCDockable, AnySlider, AnySortView, AnySpinner, AnySplit, AnyTabbedPane, AnyTable, AnyText, AnyToggleButton, AnyToolBar, AnyTree, AnyView, AnyWindow, BasicProcess, BasicProcess.RootMap, BOTDescriptor, ClientMonitor, ClientObject, CompileInq, DeadlockScanner, EventDispatcher, EventMultiplexer, Exec, InstanceHierarchyMap, IoProcess, LinkMap, ListenTo.EventDispatcherListeningTo, LoadDescriptors, LoginDenied, LoginOK, ManagedObject, MetaToJson, MultiHierarchyMap, NodeEventPropagator, NullService, ProxyProcess, RemoteDescriptor, ReplaceNode, RunInq, ServerListener, ServerMonitor, Service, SyncGraphicsService, SystemLogin, SystemLogout, UserProcess

    public interface EventGenerator
extends Any
    Definition of an event generator within the Any framework. Unlike the Java Beans/Swing event structure, we prescribe that any class generating events implements this interface, because we are not interested in using introspection to determine the addXXXListener methods, or in using specific class types to indicate the type of event we are

    An event generator's function is to deliver events to registered targets. Implementations are free to define things like their own thread policy, whether they filter or augment events passing through them and so on.

    The event generator is similar to an adaptor in the Java Beans design, or to a channel in corba.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    $Author: sanderst $
    See Also:
    Any

    • Method Detail

      • fireEvent

        void fireEvent(Event e)
        throws AnyException
        Send the given event to all registered listeners.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(EventListener l,
                      Any eventParam)
        Add an event listener. When fireEvent is called the event may be propagated to the registered listeners. The event listener may parameterise the event it receives with the supplied Any.

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(EventListener l)

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(EventListener l)
        Remove an event listener.

      • removeAllListeners

        void removeAllListeners()

      • getGeneratedEventTypes

        Array getGeneratedEventTypes()
        Return the event types this generator can emit. This method is of use to event listeners (or those setting up listeners) where each event type will be processed in a different way.

      • makeEvent

        Event makeEvent(Any eventType)
        An optional operation which is implemented by true event originators, as opposed to those generators which merely act as propagators. Yields an event of the specified type provided that type is valid for this EventGenerator.

      • raiseAgainstChildren

        boolean raiseAgainstChildren(Event e)
        Whether, during iteration over a node space, this EventGenerator advises events may be raised against its children.
        Parameters:
        e - The event that would be raised.
        Returns:
        true if it is valid to raise events against this EventGenerator's children, false if it is not.
